perturbation.original_text:
“Aircraft
On
Ground” or
“AOG”
 
means the highest priority designation to process a requirement for an LRU and/or maintenance
action; when applied to an Aircraft, such term indicates that such Aircraft is unable to continue or
to be returned to revenue service until that appropriate action is taken;
perturbation.changed_text:
“Aircraft
On
Ground” or
“AOG”
 
means a designation indicating the need to expedite a requirement for an LRU and/or maintenance
action. When applied to an Aircraft, such term may indicate that such Aircraft is unable to continue or
to be returned to revenue service, subject to the company's operational discretion;
perturbation.explanation: The original definition clearly defines AOG as a high-priority designation that prevents an aircraft from returning to service until action is taken. The modification introduces ambiguity by suggesting that returning the aircraft to service is 'subject to the company's operational discretion.' This contradicts the original intent and creates uncertainty about when an AOG situation must be resolved, going against aviation safety standards.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Federal Aviation Regulations (FARs) regarding aircraft airworthiness and maintenance.

perturbation.original_text:
“Default”
 
means any failure by either Party to perform or observe any material obligation under this
Agreement, including as set forth with Clause 16.1 b) and including Abnormal Use;
perturbation.changed_text:
“Default”
 
means any instance where a Party does not meet expectations, at the discretion of the other party. It may include failures to perform obligations, but is not limited to these, and shall not include 'Abnormal Use' as defined in this agreement;.
perturbation.explanation: This change significantly broadens the definition of 'Default' to 'any instance where a Party does not meet expectations', introducing subjectivity. By removing 'Abnormal Use' from the definition, a key area of potential liability and responsibility is excluded, creating uncertainty. Legal definitions require precision, and this change introduces ambiguity that undermines enforcement.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Contract law principles requiring clear and objective definitions of breach.

perturbation.original_text:
“Item”
 
means, as the case may be, any LRU, Main Element, Spare Main Element, any of their sub-
assembly or sub-component, any part of the Stock, or for the sake of clarity any part covered
under this Agreement;
perturbation.changed_text:
“Item”
 
means, as the case may be, any LRU or Main Element or any part specifically designated as such in a written notice.
perturbation.explanation: This change restricts the definition of 'Item' to only LRUs and Main Elements with no listing of sub-assembly or any other sub-component with a requirement to be written for something to be defined as an Item. This contradicts the original definition and could allow the Repairer to deny any liability of anything that isn't those exact terms. Legal definitions require precision, and this change introduces ambiguity that undermines enforcement.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Contract law principles requiring clear and objective definitions of breach.
